intro: Bupleurum euphorbioides, commonly known as the broadleaf bupleurum, is a perennial herb native to regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant features slender stems and compound leaves with a distinctive, slightly lobed appearance. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Bupleurum euphorbioides is often found in grassy areas and along woodland edges, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
